com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getReturnFulfillmentSummaryDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getReturnFulfillmentSummaryDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getReturnFulfillmentSummaryDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      This API will take the unique attributes of the order as the input and return the output grouped based on the fulfillment methods.

    • Method Detail

      • getReturnFulfillmentSummaryDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getReturnFulfillmentSummaryDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                        java.rmi.RemoteException
        This API will take the unique attributes of the order as the input and return the output grouped based on the fulfillment methods. So, there are ShipingGroup and PickupGroup elements which have order lines that are Shipping and Pickup respectively. It also returns the another group CustomerKeepGroup, which is a group of order lines which are marked as customer can keep for returns. The third group CustomerKeepGroup is only considered if the attribute OrderLineTypeForCustomerKeep is passed in the input. The value for this attribute in the input, will be considered as LineType value for order lines to be considered for grouping lines in the group CustomerKeepGroup. This API currently ignores the order lines which have fulfillment method Delivery.

        This API works in two modes.
        1. Small Order Mode (Default Mode):
        In this mode the IsLargeOrder flag is set to "N" In this mode API will obtain the order details from getCompleteOrderDetails API and sends all the order lines in the output in all the groups passed in the output template.

        ShippingGroups element is available when there are order lines which have Shipping as the fulfillment method The order lines of the shipping fulfillment method are formed based on the ShipNode marked on the order lines. Hence, there will be ShippingGroup element for every distinct ShipNode value on the order lines. The ShipNode element under the ShippingGroup element represents the Store or Node, where the order lines within the ShippingGroup are going to be shipped.

        PickupGroups element is available if there are order lines which have Pickup as the delivery method. Each PickupGroup represents the pickup address from where the customer has asked to pickup the items for return. The PersonInfoShipto element under the PickupGroup element represents the pickup address, where the order lines within the PickupGroup are going to be picked-up from.

        CustomerKeepGroup element is available if there are order lines which are marked with a specific LineType. The value for the attribute OrderLineTypeForCustomerKeep in the input, will be considered as LineType value for order lines to be considered for grouping lines in the group CustomerKeepGroup.

        2. Large Order Mode:
        In this mode the IsLargeOrder flag is set to "Y". API doesn't fetch the the order lines. It returns the order details by calling getCompleteOrderDetails API. Additionally, API doesn't fetch the order lines in this mode. It just gives the unique Ship To Addresses in the order , and the unique pickup groups in the order.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Additional Information


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the order details grouped based on fulfillment details. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
